result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sylvon Pierre Campbell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sylvon Pierre Campbell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Richard L. Voss Mr. in court for Sylvon Pierre Campbell.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a final pretrial and Motion hearing Defense's Denny Motion. State does not object to the motion. Court grants Defense's Denny Motion. Defendant is to provide a DNA sample. Court vacates the scheduled jury trial and adjourns matter for a status. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 9:00 am; court is down October 17, 2022.  Parties agreed to new jury trial date, via email.  Jury trial adjourned for October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.
Court sets bail at $500 cash and finds the speedy trial demand to be essentially vacated

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Sylvon Pierre Campbell not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris, appearing for Dennis Murphy, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Court is advised that defendant has been revoked.
Court finds that the speedy trial demand is therefore moot and vacates the speedy trial demand; objection by defense counsel.

Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial/motion hearing and jury trial in Branch 28.  Jury trial of July 5 is vacated from the court's calendar.

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.

Court will address bail.

Clerk:  jms

Case cannot be heard on June 10, 2022 as court will not be in session; hearing must be rescheduled.
Deputy clerk in contact with the parties via telephone and electronic mail.
Case is adjourned for scheduing in Branch 28 on June 7, 2022.

Clerk:  jms
Brief In Support Of Denny Motion - received
Motion To Allow Denny Type Evidence At Trial - received
Notice Of Denny Evidence - received
Motion hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Speedy trial demand (expires July 5, 2022)

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Sylvon Pierre Campbell not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.

Court is advised that defendant has pending cases in Branch 1 and Branch 10.
Bail arguments to the court; State objects to modification of bail.
Court reviews defendant's record with the parties.
For reasons stated on the record, Court declines to modify bail at this time.

Defense counsel requests adjournment for trial and enters a speedy trial demand.
Further, defense counsel advises Court he will be filing a motion.
Court orders case adjourned for motion hearing/final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 28.

Defense to file any motion with the court as of May 6, 2022.  State's response/reply to be filed with the court no later than June 6, 2022.

Clerk:  jms
Received & Filed, Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (13 pages) commencing 3-8-2022 by DANIELLE N. HOLCOMB.
Notice Of Motion And Motion For Modification Of Bail - received

Defendant Sylvon Pierre Campbell in court with Attorney Richard L. Voss; both appear by video.  Defendant Sylvon Pierre Campbell in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective J. Ivy. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Sylvon Pierre Campbell not in court, in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was not served and is out ill. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
    99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Victim LAV
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Sylvon Pierre Campbell
Current: 2911 N 19th St, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 02-09-2022)
Prior: 2428 North 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Sylvon Pierre Campbell in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Sylvon Pierre Campbell in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sylvon Pierre Campbell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Motion to dismiss for lack of probable cause by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
    99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
